locations.name: My Room
locations.brief_description: You are in your dorm room. To the South, there is a hallway leading to Reception. To the North, another hallway leads to a backdoor.
locations.long_description: You are in your dorm room, a small but familiar space. The walls are lined with shelves filled with textbooks, random papers, and a few mementos from home. It's quiet—too quiet, perhaps—aside from the hum of your laptop on the desk. Your bed is unmade, with clothes scattered around. To the South, there is a hallway leading to Reception. To the North, another hallway leads to a backdoor. Oh wait, don't use your phone; it will distract you!

locations.name: South Hallway
locations.brief_description: You are in the South Hallway. To the North, you can go to your room. To the South, you will find the Reception.
locations.long_description: You are in the South Hallway. As you look around, you notice a small note pinned to the wall near the door to Reception. It has the receptionist's number written on it, just in case you need assistance. It is 416-978-4500. To the South, you will find the Reception. To the North, you can go to your room.

locations.name: Knox College Reception
locations.brief_description: You are in Knox College Reception. To the South, you will leave to St. George st. To the North, there is the hallway.
locations.long_description: You are at the Knox College Reception. The small, quiet area is empty. The soft hum of the building is the only sound. It looks like no one is here, so you'll have to use your cellphone to reach the receptionist. To the South, you will leave to St. George st. To the North, there is the hallway.

locations.name: St. George Street
locations.brief_description: Now you are out in St. Gerorge st. To East, you enter Art & Science building. To North, you enter Knox College Reception
locations.long_description: Now you are out in St. Gerorge st. To East, you enter Art & Science building. To North, you enter Knox College Reception

locations.name: Art & Science Building
locations.brief_description: You are in the Art & Science Building. To East, there is Robarts library. To West, you leave to St. George st.
locations.long_description: You are in the Art & Science Building, a place you were just at for your MAT137 tutorial. The hustle of students heading to and from classes fills the air, but you’re more focused on the task at hand—retrieving your lost laptop charger. You scan the area, but all you find is a crumpled piece of paper lying on the ground. You might want to check it out. Wait, this looks familiar. It’s part of the password to the computer you used to print CSC111 practice test, that you ripped earlier. The paper has the following two digits written on it: -62-. You remember heading over to Robarts Library after leaving the Art & Science Building. It’s possible you left your charger there. To East, there is Robarts library. To West, you leave to St. George st.

locations.name: Robarts Library
locations.brief_description: You are in Robarts Library. To the North, the reception desk is just ahead. To the West, you enter Art & Science building.
locations.long_description: You are in Robarts Library, a towering building filled with study spaces, quiet corners, and students buried in textbooks. The air smells of old paper and coffee, and the low hum of whispered conversations fills the space. You’ve come here after your time in the Art & Science Building, hoping that your laptop charger might have been left behind. As you make your way through the library, your eyes catch something on one of the desks—a crumpled piece of paper. You pick it up and unfold it. It’s the second part of the paper, this part has: -75-. You decide to head over to the library reception to ask if anyone has turned in a lost charger. To the North, the reception desk is just ahead. To the West, you enter Art & Science building.

locations.name: Robarts Reciption
locations.brief_description: You are at Robarts Reception. To the North, stairs to second floor. To the South, Robarts Library.
locations.long_description: You are at Robarts Reception, the desk neatly arranged with pamphlets and a computer screen displaying library hours. The receptionist looks up from their desk as you approach. After you ask about your laptop charger, they nod sympathetically. "I'm afraid we don’t keep personal items at the reception. You’ll need to check the Lost and Found area. It’s located on the third floor. If it's been turned in, that’s where it would be."With this new lead, you thank the receptionist, but before heading to the third floor, you decide to check Starbucks on the first floor. You remember grabbing a coffee there earlier and wonder if you might have left your charger there instead. To the North, stairs to second floor. To the South, Robarts Library.

locations.name: Stairs to Second Floor
locations.brief_description: You are at the Stairs to the Second Floor. Nothing here but the familiar creak of old steps, leading up to the second floor of Robarts Library. There’s no indication of anything special, just a simple stairwell with a few students passing by as they head up. To the East, you can head to Starbucks. To the South, you’ll find the Robarts Reception where you spoke with the librarian.
locations.long_description: You are at the Stairs to the Second Floor. Nothing here but the familiar creak of old steps, leading up to the second floor of Robarts Library. There’s no indication of anything special, just a simple stairwell with a few students passing by as they head up. To the East, you can head to Starbucks. To the South, you’ll find the Robarts Reception where you spoke with the librarian.

locations.name: Starbucks
locations.brief_description: You are at Starbucks. To the North, there is the Second-floor common area. To the West, you go to the stairs.
locations.long_description: You are at Starbucks, a cozy corner of Robarts Library with the comforting scent of coffee and pastries in the air. A few students are sitting with their laptops, and the sound of espresso machines fills the background. You scan the tables, hoping to spot your missing laptop charger. As you walk to one of the back tables, you notice a crumpled piece of paper tucked under a napkin holder. You unfold it, and this is the third part of the password. It reads: 97. To the North, there is the Second-floor common area. To the West, you go to the stairs.

locations.name: Second Floor Common Area
locations.brief_description: You are in the Second Floor Common Area. To the East, the stairs lead up to the Third Floor. To the North, you can enter the Printing Room, where students pick up their printed assignments and notes. To the South, you go to Starbucks.
locations.long_description: You are in the Second Floor Common Area, a quiet space where students gather to study or take a break between lectures. The room is lined with long tables, some occupied by students lost in their textbooks, while others are typing away on their laptops. The soft hum of quiet conversation and the occasional rustling of pages fill the air. To the East, the stairs lead up to the Third Floor. To the North, you can enter the Printing Room, where students pick up their printed assignments and notes. To the South, you go to Starbucks.

locations.name: Print Area
locations.brief_description: You are at the Print Area. To the West, you can use stairs to Backdoor . To the South, you can return to the Second Floor Common Area.
locations.long_description: You are at the Print Area, a busy section of the library where students rush to collect their freshly printed notes and assignments. The air smells faintly of ink and warm paper, and the steady hum of printers fills the background. On one of the desks, you spot your laptop, left open but locked. Relief washes over you—this means your USB drive is still plugged in. But there’s a problem: you need to unlock your computer first before you can safely eject it. To the West, you can use stairs to Backdoor . To the South, you can return to the Second Floor Common Area.

locations.name: Stairs to Back Door
locations.brief_description: You are at the Stairs to the Backdoor. To the West, you can head out to the Back Door. To the East, you can return to the Print Room.
locations.long_description: You are at the Stairs to the Backdoor. There’s nothing notable here but a set of stairs leading to an exit. The stairs creak slightly as you step on them, and the air feels cooler near the back exit. To the West, you can head out to the Back Door. To the East, you can return to the Print Room.

locations.name: Back Door
locations.brief_description: You are at the Back Door. To the West, you can return to the Stairs to the Back Door.
locations.long_description: You are at the Back Door, which leads to a hallway connected to your dorm. It’s a quicker route to get there, but you need to unlock the door first. The door requires a password, and to get it, you’ll need to solve a puzzle. The lock displays a series of numbers and symbols, waiting for you to figure out the correct combination. You’ll have to solve the puzzle to proceed. To the West, you can return to the Stairs to the Back Door.

locations.name: North hallway
locations.long_description: You are in North hallway, there is nothing here. You see a backdoor that might lead to Robarts Library. To the South, you can enter your room.

locations.name: Stairs to Third Floor
locations.brief_description: You are at the Stairs to the Third Floor. To the East, you can enter the Third Floor Common Room. To the West, you can return to the Second Floor Common Area.
locations.long_description: You are at the Stairs to the Third Floor. Nothing special here—just a quiet stairwell with a few students passing by, heading up or down between floors. The walls are bare except for a few outdated posters pinned to a notice board. To the East, you can enter the Third Floor Common Room. To the West, you can return to the Second Floor Common Area.

locations.name: Third Floor Common Area
locations.brief_description: You are in the Third Floor Common Area. To the South, you can head to the Lost and Found to check for your laptop charger. To the West, you can return to the Stairs to the Second Floor.
locations.long_description: You are in the Third Floor Common Area, a quieter study space with dim lighting and a few scattered students working in silence. The air feels heavier here, as if the weight of deadlines and upcoming exams hangs over the room. A few empty coffee cups are left behind on tables, evidence of long study sessions. As you move between the tables, something catches your eye—a small, crumpled piece of paper wedged between two books on a nearby shelf. You pick it up and unfold it. Another part of the password! It reads: -09-. To the South, you can head to the Lost and Found to check for your laptop charger. To the West, you can return to the Stairs to the Second Floor.

locations.name: Lost and Found
locations.brief_description: You are at the Lost and Found. To the South, you can head to the Private Study Room to check. To the North, you can return to the Third Floor Common Area.
locations.long_description: You are at the Lost and Found, a small, cluttered office filled with misplaced notebooks, forgotten water bottles, and an impressive collection of unclaimed sweaters. A staff member behind the counter looks up as you ask about your laptop charger. "Sorry, we don’t have any chargers turned in today. Maybe try checking where you last used it?" As you think back, it suddenly hits you—you might have left it in the Private Study Room! To the South, you can head to the Private Study Room to check. To the North, you can return to the Third Floor Common Area.

locations.name: Study Room
locations.brief_description: You are at the Study Room. To the West, you can take the stairs up to the Fourth Floor. To the North, you can return to the Lost and Found.
locations.long_description: You are at the Study Room, a small, enclosed space meant for quiet, focused work. The walls are lined with whiteboards covered in scribbled equations and half-finished notes. A single overhead light casts a dim glow over the desk in the center of the room. Someone is already here, hunched over their laptop, completely absorbed in their work. You freeze. Your laptop charger is somewhere in this room—you’re sure of it—but the thought of interrupting them makes your chest tighten. What if they get annoyed? What if they give you a weird look? To the West, you can take the stairs up to the Fourth Floor. To the North, you can return to the Lost and Found.

locations.name: Stairs to Forth Floor
locations.brief_description: You are at the Stairs to the Fourth Floor. To the West, you can return to the Study Room.
locations.long_description: You are at the Stairs to the Fourth Floor. The steps are cracked, with caution tape lazily draped across the entrance. A faded sign reads: "Under Maintenance – Do Not Use." It’s clear you won’t be going any further this way. There’s nothing here but broken stairs. To the West, you can return to the Study Room.

locations.brief_description: You find yourself in a Secret Room. To the North, you can go back to the study room.
locations.long_description: You find yourself in a Secret Room, hidden away from the usual corridors of the library and dorms. The space is dimly lit, with shelves full of dusty old books and strange artifacts. In the center of the room, perched on a small rug, sits a magical capybara. It looks up at you with intelligent eyes and gives a slight nod. "Ah, I see you've found me," it says, its voice surprisingly clear and soothing. "I have the power to grant you something that could help you on your quest... I can give you an extra 10 moves. But be careful, as time can be a fickle thing." The capybara looks at you expectantly, awaiting your decision. To the North, you can go back to the study room.

items.name: cellphone
items.description: You can use your phone to make calls!

items.name: USB drive
items.description: he only copy of your game, because of course you forgot to back it up

items.name: lucky mug
items.description: This is your lucky mug!!! you can't do anything without it!!!!

items.name: laptop charger
items.description: your battery is 5%, you need it to charge your laptop.

puzzles.name: submit project

win.text: Nice, you submitted it with two minutes to spare!

puzzles.lose: You don’t have the required items to submit your project.

puzzles.name: call reception

win.text:
They said you left it in the bathroom cabinet. OH! 
 You use it while brushing your teeth to save water. That makes sense!

puzzles.lose: Wait, who is this? Sorry, wrong number.
puzzles.dialogue: You don’t have your phone on you, how can you call them?

puzzles.name: unlock computer

win.text: Nice! Thank God you found the password!

puzzles.lose: Oh no, the password is wrong!

puzzles.name: social anxiety
puzzles.prompt: Enter what you take to the other side in order and space seperated (fox, goose, beans, alone):

win.text: goose alone fox goose beans alone goose

answer: goose alone fox goose beans alone goose
goose alone beans goose fox alone goose
puzzles.dialogue:
You don't have the confidence to get in the room! So, let’s make a bet: if you solve this puzzle, "
                "you should knock and go in. After all, it’s a tough one, and you did it! You have a fox, a goose, and a bag of beans. You need to cross a river with them, "
                "but the boat can only carry you and one item at a time.\n"
                "If left alone together, the fox will eat the goose, and the goose will eat the beans. "
                "How can you get them all across safely?

puzzles.name: backdoor

win.text: door unlocked and you ran toward your college.

puzzles.dialogue:
"You need to figure out the 4-digit code to unlock the door. The clues written behind the door are:\n"
                "1.The code is made up of four digits.\n"
                "2.The second number is greater than the first\n"
                "3.The sum of all digits is 18.\n"
                "4.The third number is half the second digit.\n"
                "5.The fourth number is one less than the third."
